Interface ISysComponent

All Known Subinterfaces:
ISysBus, ISysConfig, ISysConfigManager, ISysDBRequester, ISysDBRService, ISysIndexableMessage, ISysLogChecker, ISysLogFormatter, ISysLogger, ISysLogWriter, ISysMessage, ISysMessageService, ISysService, ISysTable, ISysVariableValueMessage
All Known Implementing Classes:
ASysBus, ASysDBRService, ASysLogChecker, ASysLogFormatter, ASysLogger, ASysLogWriter, ASysMessage, ASysService, ASysServiceStub, CSysHtmlPageWriter, CSysSourcelessConfig, DummyISysBus, DummyISysComponent, DummyISysConfig, DummyISysConfigManager, DummyISysDBRequester, DummyISysDBRService, DummyISysIndexableMessage, DummyISysLogChecker, DummyISysLogFormatter, DummyISysLogger, DummyISysLogWriter, DummyISysMessage, DummyISysMessageService, DummyISysService, DummyISysTable, DummyISysVariableValueMessage
public interface ISysComponent

The interface ISysComponent is the base interface of all Systema component interfaces. Therefore it describes the elementary functionality of all Systema components.
Additionally the component type values are defined here. This must be the return value of method getComponentType(). (It is e.g. used for component logging and must correspond to the component log level in the configuration.)

Version:
$Revision: 1.10 $
Author:
Herbert Helmstreit, Udo Friedrich

Method Detail

getComponentName

public String getComponentName()
Get the name of this ISysComponent

Returns:
the name of this ISysComponent. E.g. "CSysWindowsExplorer".

getComponentType

public String getComponentType()
Get the type of this ISysComponent

Returns:
the type of this ISysComponent. E.g. "Explorer".

getComponentVersion

public String getComponentVersion()
Get the version of this ISysComponent

Returns:
the version of this ISysComponent. E.g. "1.0.0".

setProperty

public void setProperty(String key,
                        String value)
                 throws ASysException
Set a runtime property of this ISysComponent Component interfaces may suggest possible key value pairs. Implementations i.e. components must specify supported key value pairs.

Parameters:
key - The name of the property e.g. "delivery"
value - The value of the property e.g. "certified"
Throws:
ASysException - if the property can not be set.

getProperty

public String getProperty(String key)
Return the value for the given key.

Parameters:
key - the name of the property e.g. "delivery".
Returns:
the value of the adressed property. If there is none, the component should return null.

getPropertyInfo

public String[][] getPropertyInfo()
Get info about the allowed parameters.

Returns:
an array of allowed parameters, the expected data type, allowed values and a description of the parameter. If there is none, the component should return null.
